comments:
Build 20020411.

I'm experimenting with launching the platform from PDE using 
my own specialized intall.ini and primary features.

When I omit the "Application Name:" parameter from the runtime
workbench launch configuration, I get the following walkback.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: 
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass
(DelegatingURLClassLoader.java:755)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:257)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup
(InternalBootLoader.java:879)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:767)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:14)
Exception in thread "main" 

Aside: I noticed that the applicationName parameter in BootLoader.run is
strange: 
d:\corews\plugins\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\D__eclipse-
20020411_eclipse_runtime-workspace\plugin_path.properties
This may or may not be related to not finding the class InternalPlatform.

Expected behavior:
- it should be fine to specify no application (actually,
this should probably be the default). The platform should report/log
and error if it can't determine which application to run.

Fixed.
The default now is an unspecified application name, and it runs without error.
